quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Game and Designer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: It is generally accepted that the game of golf originated in this country.
What is the language of flowers called?
This designer is particularly noted for his menswear, but he also introduced a ladies wear line in 1975.  The brand was much popularized by Richard Gere in the title role of American Gigolo.
What is the function of the pancreas?

options.text: It pumps blood through the blood vessels.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It produces insulin.

questions.question: What is the name of the character played by Susan Lucci on the ABC soap opera All My Children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erica Kane

questions.question: This designer brand was created in 1978 by Gianni, and is currently headed by Donatella.  The products are distributed through a network of 240 exclusive boutiques, over 150 dedicated spaces in major department stores and duty-free areas, as well as a number of multi-brand boutiques in 60 countries.  The company has many brands including Gianni, Versus, Jeans Couture, Ceramic Designs, Classic, Classic V2, Sport, Intensive, Precious Items, Young and Palazzo.
What was the original name of Mario, the protagonist of the Super Mario Bros. video game?
Who is the author of the legendary Peter Rabbit series of childrens books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beatrix Potter

questions.question: Which statement regarding the investigative CBS TV program 60 Minutes is true?

options.text: It was created by Ed Bradley.
It has the longest theme song.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It has no theme music.

questions.question: What is Odontophobia?

options.text: a fear of teeth or dental procedures
a fear of the color yellow

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a fear of teeth or dental procedures

questions.question: Which of these animals is immune to rattlesnake venom?

This Milan-based designer company is very popular for their designs in the Hollywood industry, they have designed clothes for Madonna, Monica Bellucci,  Isabella Rossellini, Kylie Minogue, Angelina and others.  The first names of its owners are Domenico and Stefano.  Their first collection was shown in 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolce  Gabbana

questions.question: Natural gas has no odor.
When people die their hair continues to grow for a couple of months.
The blue rose acts as a clue in which of these movies?

options.text: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Dog and Rookie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, rookie, invention. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This dog is almost as famous as Shakespeare.  He was mentioned 151 times and the only canine to ever appear in a Shakespearean play.
Who was the first baseball player to be named rookie of the year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackie Robinson

questions.question: A popular family TV series made this dog famous.   Her story began as a short story written for Saturday Evening Post in 1938.
This Yorkshire Terrier became a hero in World War II.  He participated in battles for 18 months.   During that time he flew on 12 combat missions of 22 hours nonstop.
When did the first laundromat in the USA open?
Advertising of record label HMV (His Masters Voice) made this dog famous.  It showed the dog listening to his masters gramophone.
In what year was the state of California admitted to the Union?
This famous dog is known as a party animal.   He first appeared on the TV screen water skiing, laughing and skateboarding in a 1987 Bud Light beer commercial.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spuds MacKenzie

questions.question: You may have seen this dog on the comedy series Frasier.  He also appeared on the cover of Life, TV Guide and Entertainment Weekly.

This puppy was rescued from debris of shattered buildings in Germany during World War I.   He stared in 25 movies including, Where The North Begins  (1925).  He signed contracts by himself with his paw print.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rin Tin Tin

questions.question: This german shepherd was Adolf Hitlers favorite dog.  Before Hitler committed suicide using cyanide he tested it on the dog.
Who was the first woman to serve on the U.S. Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandra Day OConnor

questions.question: This dog belonged to the 42nd US President, Bill Clinton.  He was named after an uncle who raised and trained dogs for 50 years before he died.
Who is credited with the invention of MMs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Forrest Mars Sr.

questions.question: This dog was the first living being to orbit planet Earth.  She went into space aboard the Soviet Unions Sputnik 2 on November 3, 1957.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Pizza and Pizzas
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cartoon, definition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the definition of the word Embolus, which comes from a Greek word, meaning a wedge or plug?

options.text: A rupture of a blood vessel in the brain
A blood clot, a clump of bacteria or foreign material, that travels through the bloodstream, lodges in a blood vessel and blocks it
Inflammation of a joint, accompanied by pain and swelling

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A blood clot, a clump of bacteria or foreign material, that travels through the bloodstream, lodges in a blood vessel and blocks it

questions.question: Cerebral palsy,  first identified by the British surgeon, William Little in 1860, refers to a large group of movement disorders. When the two lower limbs are affected, cerebral palsy is defined by which term?
The very first pizza was made in Italy and is considered to be an Italian food.

Italians may not be the first ones to eat pizzas but they surely were the ones to name it.  The word pizza in its current spelling emerged some time in Middle Ages.  It was used to describe the sweet and salty pies that were very popular among this social class in Italy.
Pizza became a total hit all over the USA in ...?
Fainting is a loss of consciousness due to temporary insufficient blood flow to the brain. What is he medical term for fainting?

Tuberculosis is an infection, caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis, which most commonly affects the lungs. Among the symptoms of Tuberculosis are fatigue, weakness, coughing and hemoptysis.  What does the term hemoptysis refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coughing up blood

questions.question: Pizza is the favorite food of these cartoon characters.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

questions.question: In the beginning of the 21th century, Pizza Hut is reckoned as the largest pizza maker.
How many pizzas are eaten in the USA every year on the average?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three billion pizzas

questions.question: The man who is believed to have made pizza an international hit is Raffaele Esposito, who in 1889 baked pizzas for King Umberto and Queen Margherita. That pizza consisted of mozzarella, basil and tomatoes. Why did the baker choose these three ingredients?

options.text: Because the colours of the three ingredients were the same as the colours on the Italian flag.
Because they were the Kings favorites.
Because these were the only ingredients that could be found in Italy at that time.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because the colours of the three ingredients were the same as the colours on the Italian flag.

questions.question: A transient ischemic attack, or TIA, is caused by temporary disturbance of blood supply to a restricted area of the brain. Could TIA be considered a warning that a cerebrovascular accident (a stroke) is likely to occur?
Eating pizza once a week can reduce the risk of this disease.

Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) is a method of creating images of the inside of opaque organs in living organisms, used to distinguish pathological tissue (such as a brain tumor) from healthy tissue.
In what year was the worlds first pizza parlor built?

questions.question: Prepare a tub of diluted, cool tea, add some lemon juice and a pinch of salt. It will help if you have this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tired feet

questions.question: Tea could reduce the risk for gastric, esophageal, and skin types of these.
This disease, commonly known as Lou Gehrigs disease, occurs when the nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord gradually deteriorate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis

questions.question: Five cups of green tea per day could reduce your risks of cancer.  It also promotes this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mental activity

questions.question: Green tea and Oolong tea cause calories to burn faster, and  thus help control this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Body weight

questions.question: For the most part. (adverb)
Tea is refreshing and stimulating because it contains this.
As tea inhibits growth of bacteria, it helps fight this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad breath

questions.question: What condition is characterized by blindness in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes?

Multiple sclerosis is a chronic disease that affects the brain and spinal cord. Among the various symptoms of the disease is a shock-like sensation that runs down the back and into the legs, and is caused by bending the neck forward. What is the medical term for this symptom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lhermittes sign

questions.question: You should not have too much tea;  one side effect could be this.
Tea is rich in fluoride, so it helps maintain these healthy.

Tee is a good anti-stress therapy. Flavonoids may prevent oxidation of bad cholesterol in the blood, which leads to accumulation of plaque in artery walls. It also prevents blood clot formation.  Thus, tea is good for this too.
Tea helps you look good, as it is rich in flavonoids. These are strong antioxidants that fight this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Free radicals

questions.question: The medical term, Bradycardia refers to an abnormally fast heart rate.
